title: [Whistler's Pass]
description: Minute cacti, their bulbous stalks armed with an array of needle-like spines, sprout from jagged cracks in the stone.  Their spiny profiles lend texture to the otherwise smooth walls of the bleak pass.

Minute cacti, their bulbous stalks armed with an array of needle-like spines, sprout from jagged cracks in the stone.  Dark hues, from deep greens to brilliant purples, adorn their flesh, lending some color to the otherwise bleak pass.
